etymology.type: Simplified form of 見 (from cursive script)
etymology.description: Simplified from 見; original 見 is ideogrammic compound: 目 (eye) + 卩 (kneeling person).
etymology.interpretation: Modern 见 is a cursive-derived shorthand of 見, depicting an eye atop a kneeling figure. The original components, 目 and 卩, evoke the act of looking or seeing.
etymology.simplification: Adopted a cursive outline that merges and compresses the kneeling-person component while highlighting the eye, reducing strokes for faster writing.

examples.chinese: 我看见你了(我看見你了)。
我们明天见面吧(我們明天見面吧)。
终于见到老朋友了(終於見到老朋友了)。
